data.title: Bishop Ludden School Staff Directory - Syraucse, NY Private School
data.meta_description: View & meet the dedicated, caring and passionate members of the Bishop Ludden Junior-Senior High School Staff, including our administrators, teachers and other faculty, located in Syracuse, NY.
data.text:
Dr. Lynn Reimer moved to Syracuse from Central California in 2022 with her husband, Kevin, and dog, Leo, to complete a year of service for L’Arche working with the developmentally disabled in their homes. She is excited to live in an area with so many places to hike and explore, as being outdoors is her favorite place to be (even in the snow!).

Dr. Reimer has taught for 20 years, mostly middle school and high school math and science. However, she has also taught at the undergraduate and graduate level. This is the first year she has taught in New York and the first year she has taught at a Catholic school and feels blessed to have her faith be such an integral part of her day. Dr. Reimer completed her undergraduate education at the University of California, Davis double majoring in Biology and German. She earned her teaching certificate at Fresno State University and her MA in integrated math/science instruction at Fresno Pacific University. She then earned her PhD in Education from the University of California, Irvine as a National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellow. She proudly admits that she is a math/science nerd.

Classes

Geometry

Algebra I

IB Core I

IB Core II

Shaun Smith comes to Bishop Ludden with more than 30 years of experience in education and coaching. He graduated from SUNY Cortland with a degree in physical education and earned his master’s in special education from Syracuse University. Shaun was a longtime physical education teacher at Corcoran High School. Since retiring from the Syracuse City School District in 2020, he has been subbing on a regular basis at Bishop Ludden. Throughout his teaching career, Shaun coached high school football, basketball, and lacrosse. Currently, he is the Varsity Boys Lacrosse Coach at Jordan Elbridge where he helped to facilitate the opportunity for players from Bishop Ludden to play lacrosse there. Shaun is also coaching Modified Football for Bishop Ludden. Shaun lives in Syracuse with his wife Kristin, a teacher at Liverpool High School, and their son Ryan, a recent college graduate. Their daughter, Brianna, is an elementary school teacher in the Guilderland School District in Albany. An avid sports fan, he can usually be found on the golf course or cheering on his favorite football teams on weekends.

Classes

Physical Education

Mrs. Babcock has been teaching at Bishop Ludden since 2008. Certified in Social Studies 7-12 and English 7-12, she has taught every grade from 7-12 since starting at Thousand Islands High School in 1985. She coached JV Soccer, JV Basketball, and Varsity Basketball at TI. She currently teaches Computers 8, Food Science, Natural Hazards and Disasters, and Forensic Science. She previously taught English 8, 9,10, and 11 for six years at Bishop Ludden before becoming the Library Director for eight years. Before joining the Science Department. She graduated from Alma College in Michigan with undergraduate degrees in both History and English. She was Alma College’s Field Hockey MVP in 1982 and was named to the All-MIAA team that year. Her Master of Science degree came from Syracuse University in Social Studies 7-12. She is currently employed by ESM Central School District as a Homebound Tutor and BOCES as a summer school teacher in Social Studies and English.

Mrs. Babcock founded the Bishop Ludden STEM program with Dr. Linda Mandanas in 2009. She has coached Science Olympiad since 2009, taking the team to the State Championship in 2011,2022, and 2023.All three of her children competed for Bishop Ludden’s Science Olympiad squad. She coached the MasterMinds, NY team to the state championship in 2021, and to the seventh place trophy in the Small School National Championship Tournament, Open Division in 2021. Her team also won the DoubleDown championship in 2019. She is the Head Quiz Bowl coach, with teams qualified for the SSNCT since 2019. She also coaches the CNY Rocket Team Challenge Teams, The Innovation Challenge Teams, and previously coached the First Lego League Teams and Vex Robotics Teams. She switched from Robotics and MasterMinds to eSports in 2021. Mrs. Babcock founded the Bishop Ludden eSports program, a varsity sport, in 2021, starting with Rocket League. The program currently has a Rocket League squad, two Super Smash Bros teams, and a Mario Kart squad.

In her free time, she enjoys her cat, trying to find time to travel with her husband, working out at Elevate Fitness and Trillium Fitness classes and reading mysteries.

Classes

Computers 8

Food Science

Natural Hazards and Disasters

Forensic Science

Miss Hanson was born and raised in Syracuse, NY with her parents and four siblings. She graduated from Le Moyne College in 2018 with her Bachelor’s in Biology and Secondary Education. She earned her MSEd in Biology from SUNY Brockport in 2021. Miss Hanson has taught Living Environment and 7th Grade Science for five years at Bishop Ludden, but has since switched roles to be the IB Biology Teacher and Campus Minister!

Miss Hanson is the JV/Modified Softball Coach at Ludden and in her free time loves to play recreational softball and volleyball. She is also a competitive a cappella singer for the Spirit of Syracuse Chorus and cantors at St. Cecilia’s Church.

Miss Hanson loves the outdoors, collecting rubber ducks, spending time with her family, and going on adventures with her dog, Potato!

Classes

IB Biology

Rhonda Henderson

Associates in Studio Art from Cazenovia College, Bachelors degree in Art Education from Syracuse University, Masters in Curriculum and Instruction from SUNY Oswego

Head of the art department, Mrs. Rhonda Henderson has been teaching at Bishop Ludden since 1996. She’s also a professional wildlife artist and has won many state-wide ribbons.

Mrs. Henderson is also the advisor for the yearbook, as well as the senior class moderator and chairperson for the Gala.

Mrs. Henderson will tell you that she “grew up” as part of the Ludden family. Since she began teaching, Mrs. Henderson has been married by fellow teacher and Bishop Ludden chaplain, Fr. Dan Muscalino. Fr. Dan has also baptised Mrs. Henderson’s oldest son and is the Godfather of her youngest.

Outside of Bishop Ludden, Mrs. Henderson has recently begun painting religious murals at St. Patrick’s Church in Jordan. The mural of the summer of 2016 was featured in the Catholic Sun.

When she’s not working on her art, Mrs. Henderson enjoys boating and snowmobiling.

Classes

IB Art

Art 8

Drawing & Painting I/II/III

Studio Art

Anne Jamison

BA with honors, Music, Kenyon College; MM, Choral Conducting, University of Wisconsin, Madison; MM, Music Education, Syracuse University

Anne Jamison has been teaching at Bishop Ludden since 2013. Before Ludden, Ms. Jamison taught at Guerin High School in Chicago, Holy Cross Elementary School in DeWitt and in the Fayetteville-Manlius School District.

Ms. Jamison is the music director for the spring musical at Bishop Ludden. An active musician herself, Ms. Jamison also serves on the board of the Syracuse Vocal Ensemble, of which she is a member. With a degree specializing in choral conducting, voice and piano, Ms. Jamison has conducted the Syracuse Children’s Chorus, as well as ensembles at Trinity College of Vermont and Beloit College.

Ms. Jamison enjoys teaching at Bishop Ludden because of the fantastic students, faculty, staff and parents, all of whom create a strong sense of community here. Hobbies of Ms. J.’s include running, hiking, cooking and choral singing.

Ms. Jamison lives in Syracuse, with her husband and two sons.

Classes

Chorus 7/8

Concert Choir

I was an Arabic linguist and intelligence analyst for the US Army. Upon my retirement from service, I obtained my Bachelor’s from Syracuse University in English and Creative Writing. I am one semester and one summer away from my master’s in comparative literature and rhetoric from Harvard University, and I am planning on continuing into a PhD through them. I will soon be certified and have a Master’s in Special Education and Literacy from SUNY Potsdam as well. I am a northern New York native who is a wife and mother of five beautiful children. My hobbies are hiking, reading, spending time with my family, learning new languages and writing poetry.

Classes

English 8

English 11

English 12
